title: How to Make a M&M Chocolate Cookie Cake

steps.headline: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180 degrees Celsius).
Put some butter in a large mixing bowl.
Add some brown sugar to the bowl.
steps.description: You can also replace this with white sugar, but brown sugar gives it a good taste.

steps.headline: Using a hand mixer, mix the ingredients.
steps.description: The consistency should be fluffy, which will take about 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Crack in one egg and a teaspoon of vanilla extract.
Mix it until it is completely combined.
Add some baking powder, and then half a cup of coco powder.
steps.description: Then, add the all-purpose plain flour.

steps.headline: Add some chocolate chips and M&Ms.
Put this mixture into the fridge for 4 hours or more, until it is good and firm.
Take a cake's container and lay in some non-stick baking paper.
Put in the cookie mixture.
steps.description: Using a base of a cup or anything strong, press down the mixture to lay it out.

steps.headline: Place it in the pre-heated oven for 20 minutes.
Remove from the oven and let it cool down.
Top it off with whipping cream to make it look like a cake.

text: Preheat your oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (180 degrees Celsius).  Put some butter in a large mixing bowl. Melt it in the microwave. Add some brown sugar to the bowl. You can also replace this with white sugar, but brown sugar gives it a good taste. Add some white sugar.  Using a hand mixer, mix the ingredients. The consistency should be fluffy, which will take about 5 minutes. Crack in one egg and a teaspoon of vanilla extract.  Mix it until it is completely combined.  Add some baking powder, and then half a cup of coco powder. Then, add the all-purpose plain flour. Mix it again until combined.  Add some chocolate chips and M&Ms.  Mix it again.  Put this mixture into the fridge for 4 hours or more, until it is good and firm.  Take a cake's container and lay in some non-stick baking paper.  Put in the cookie mixture. Using a base of a cup or anything strong, press down the mixture to lay it out. Place it in the pre-heated oven for 20 minutes.  Remove from the oven and let it cool down.  Top it off with whipping cream to make it look like a cake.
